unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Formula: Degrees of Freedom
question_text: Determine the appropriate degrees of freedom on a two-sample $T$-test with samples of size $25$ and $17$.
solution:
When it is known that variances are equal, one could pool the variances to get:

$${ { n }_{ 1 } }-1+{ { n }_{ 2 } }-1 = 24+16 = 40$$

...degrees of freedom.

However, in this situation it is not known that the variances are equal, so the most conservative approach must be used. This consists of $n-1$ degrees of freedom for the smaller sample: $17-1 = 16$ degrees of freedom.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
